title: 2000 (No. 5 of 2000), and by section 3(1) of the National Minimum Wage Act
heading: 1. (i) This Order may be cited as the National Minimum Wage Order
text_raw: 1. (i) This Order may be cited as the National Minimum Wage Order
text_norm: 1 (i) order may cited national minimum wage order

title: 2000 (No. 5 of 2000), and by section 3(1) of the National Minimum Wage Act
heading: (ii) This Order comes into operation on 1 January 2022.
text_raw:
2021. 

(ii) This Order comes into operation on 1 January 2022.

title: 2000 (No. 5 of 2000), and by section 3(1) of the National Minimum Wage Act
heading: It is hereby declared that the national minimum hourly rate of pay for
text_raw:
2. 

It is hereby declared that the national minimum hourly rate of pay for 
the purposes of the National Minimum Wage Acts 2000 and 2015 shall be 
€10.50.
text_norm: 2 hereby declared national minimum hourly rate pay purpose national minimum wage act 2000 2015 shall eur10.50

title: 2000 (No. 5 of 2000), and by section 3(1) of the National Minimum Wage Act
heading: 3. The national minimum hourly rate of pay may include the following
text_raw:
3. The national minimum hourly rate of pay may include the following 

allowances: 

(i) for board only, €0.94 per hour worked 

(ii) for lodgings only, €24.81 per week, or €3.55 per day. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

12 October, 2021. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Tánaiste and Minister for Enterprise, Trade and 
Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 15th October, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [517] 3
text_norm: 3 national minimum hourly rate pay may include following allowance (i) board eur0.94 per hour worked (ii) lodging eur24.81 per week eur3.55 per day given official seal 12 october 2021 leo varadkar tanaiste minister enterprise trade employment notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 15th october 2021 517 3

title: 2000 (No. 5 of 2000), and by section 3(1) of the National Minimum Wage Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order sets the national minimum hourly rate of pay from 1 January 2022 
at €10.50, and the board and lodging rates as follows; 

Lodgings: €24.81 per week, or €3.55 per day. 

Board: €0.94 per hour worked. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [517]
